flawed_nl_solution:
John runs 100-4=<<100-4=96>>96 meters once he reaches his max speed
He runs it in 13-1=<<13-1=12>>12 seconds
So he runs at a speed of 96/12=<<96/12=8>>8 m/s
So that means James's top speed is 8+2=<<8+2=10>>10 m/s
He has to run 100-10=<<100-10=70>>70 meters at his top speed
So he runs that at 70/10=<<70/10=7>>7 seconds
So he takes 7+2=<<7+2=9>>9 seconds to run 100 meters
#### 9

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 90, not 70. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
